variations.narrative: The room seems empty. Still water, still air. Then you see it — the surface rippling where nothing moved. Rising. It was waiting beneath.
You hear it a half-second before you see it. Wet clicks on stone. Above you. Clinging to the ceiling. Dropping. Now.
Your shadow moves wrong. You notice it too late — the Hollow is already inside your silhouette, reaching through it, reaching for you.
The corpse you stepped over isn't dead. It grabs your ankle. Its grip is stronger than anything rotten should be. Its mouth opens. No sound comes out.
A flicker at the edge of your vision. You turn. Nothing. Turn back. It's there. Right there. It was always right there.
It stands in your path. Waiting. Its head tracks your movement with patient hunger. There is no way around. Only through.
The thing blocks the door. It hasn't attacked. It hasn't moved. It's just... there. Evaluating. Whatever it decides, you won't like it.
It kneels before an altar, chanting in frequencies that hurt your thoughts. It knows you're here. The chant is for you. An invitation or a death sentence.
The knight raises a rusted blade in salute. Honorable combat. To the death. It expects you to fight well. It will be disappointed either way.
It rises from the water, twice your height, dripping with darkness. For a moment, it almost looks human. Then it opens its mouth. Then it has too many mouths.
Bones are stacked here. Arranged. This is a nest. And you've just woken what lives in it. It doesn't want to kill you. It wants you to leave. Too late for that.
The water here is warmer. Something large has been resting beneath it. That something is rising now, angry at the intrusion. This is its pool. You are trespassing.
The walls are marked with scratches. Territory. The creature emerges from a crack you didn't notice, defending ground it has claimed. Every inch cost it something.
This was a shrine once. Now it's a lair. The thing that took it doesn't worship here — it rules. And you've just entered its court uninvited.
Chains rattle in the dark. The Bound has claimed this passage. It won't let you pass. It won't let anyone pass. Its loneliness is aggressive.
You've been hearing it for three rooms now. Closer each time. Faster each time. Running isn't working. Time to stop running.
It's been following since the stairs. Patient. Relentless. You can't outpace it — it knows these tunnels. It made these tunnels. Stand and face it.
The splashing behind you stops. That's worse. That means it's not chasing anymore. That means it's already here.
The clicks are right behind you now. You can feel it breathing — if that's breathing — on your neck. Turn around. You have to. You don't want to.
Every time you look back, it's closer. It never moves when you're watching. You can't watch forever. Your eyes burn. Blink, and it ends.
One wouldn't be a threat. But there isn't one. They pour from cracks in the walls, gaps in the floor. Dozens. More coming. Always more.
The water is full of them. Small, grasping things. Alone, they're nothing. Together, they're a current of teeth and hunger. The water rises with their mass.
Hands. Just hands. They emerge from everywhere — floor, walls, ceiling. Grasping, pulling, dragging. There's no body to fight. Just hands.
The Ash Children have gathered. Watching used to be enough for them. Now they want more. They press closer. The air grows thin. They're not attacking — they're smothering.
The Echo Husks found each other. A chorus of stolen last words, shambling as one, reaching as one. 'Help me help me help me' — the same plea from a dozen ruined throats.
It's eating something. The sounds are wet, methodical. It hasn't seen you. You could sneak past. You could strike first. It will finish soon either way.
The Drowned has found a corpse. It's not eating — it's... absorbing. Growing larger. Stronger. Every moment you wait, it becomes more dangerous.
The creature crouches over something that used to be a person. It looks up. Its mouth is full. It doesn't seem upset by the interruption. It seems grateful. More food.
The Weeping has found grief to feed on. Another player's corpse, their final words still fresh. It drinks their sorrow. It turns to you. Your sorrow smells richer.
It sits among bones, cracking them open, drinking what's inside. Old bones. Ancient. It's been feeding here for centuries. You're the first fresh thing in a long time.
It stands before the door. It has always stood before this door. It will die before this door. So will you, if you want what's behind it.
The passage beyond holds something important. You can feel it. So can the thing that blocks your path. It was placed here. It has purpose. That purpose is you.
The exit is right there. Twenty feet. Between you and it stands something that has been waiting for exactly this moment. Your moment. Its purpose.
The cache is just beyond. Supplies, weapons, hope. The thing guarding it doesn't use any of those things. It just doesn't want you to have them.
It protects the shrine. Not the god — the god is dead. Not the offerings — they're rotted. It protects the idea. The memory. It will protect them from you.
The chamber is round. Smooth. Designed for this. You feel eyes on you — from where? The thing across from you doesn't care about the audience. Only about you.
Tiered seating surrounds a central pit. Empty seats, but not empty presence. Something watches. Something judges. The creature in the pit awaits your descent.
An amphitheater of bone. The acoustics are perfect — every gasp, every grunt, every death rattle will echo beautifully. The Congregation waits for the performance.
A circle is drawn on the floor. Ancient. Binding. Once you step in, you cannot leave until one of you stops moving. The thing in the circle never stops moving.
The room reconfigures as you enter. Walls rise. Exits seal. A space is created. A stage. An arena. Somewhere, something is very entertained.
It's bleeding. Dragging itself. The wounds aren't yours — someone else tried. Someone else failed. It sees you. Teeth bared. Fear and fury in equal measure.
Half of it is missing. The other half still functions. Still hunts. Reduced but not finished. It has nothing left to lose. That makes it more dangerous.
The Guardian is cracked. Pieces missing. Another adventurer did this. Where is that adventurer? Dead, probably. But they weakened it. Finish what they started.
It limps toward you. Broken, but not beaten. Every wound makes it angrier. Every pain makes it hate you more. Mercy isn't an option it understands.
Chains hang broken from its wrists. It escaped something. Or tried to. Now it's free, hurt, confused, and you're the first thing it sees. Lucky you.
